refnamediv.refpurpose: Calls dnorm function defined on R which takes x(vector of values at which the function value is to be found), the mean and standard deviation as input parameters and the result is the probability density value of normal distribution at given x

listitem.para: x : value at which normal distribution is needed
mean : the mean value of data distribution
s.d : the standard deviation of data distribution

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The function calls the dnorm() function in R that takes a vector of values , its size, mean and standard deviation as the input arguments and returns the probability density value of normal distribution for the x passed as input.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: // dnorm on x, mean and s.d y = dnorm(3,[1,2,3],0,1)

simplelist.member: Mohana N (Assistant Professor, SAS, Division of Mathematics, VIT Chennai)
